Classification of Immune Mediated Tissue Injury
[LIST_ITEM] Allergen binding to mass cell to cause degranulation
[LIST_ITEM] Result of exposure to environmental allergens in genetically susceptible individuals
[LIST_ITEM] Genetics not clearly defined, but association exists
[LIST_ITEM] Atopy: genetic predisposition for developing IgE responses to many antigens
[LIST_ITEM] Allergens: pollens, molds, house dust mites, animal dander
[LIST_ITEM] Antigen presented by APC to Th cell --> IL-4 activation of B cell
[LIST_ITEM] IgE antibodies secreted by B cell
[LIST_ITEM] IgE antibodies bind to Fc receptors on mast cells
[LIST_ITEM] Antigen binds to IgE on mast cells
[LIST_ITEM] Degranulation of mast cell releases cytokines
[LIST_ITEM] IL-3,4 stimulates GM-CSF, TNF-α, IL-8/0, inflammatory cell activation
[LIST_ITEM] Histamine --> vascular permeability, vasodilation of post-capillary venule, smooth muscle contraction
[LIST_ITEM] Arachidonic acid metabolites: LTC4,D4,E4 --> smooth muscle contraction; prostaglandins --> vasodilation
[LIST_ITEM] Acetylated glycerol ether phophocholine --> activates phagocytic cells, smooth muscle contraction
[LIST_ITEM] Normal levels: 2 to 3% of total WBCs
[LIST_ITEM] Mucous and serous glands: increased secretion
[LIST_ITEM] Bronchial and GI smooth muscle contraction
[LIST_ITEM] Leukotriene inhibitors: lipase inhibitors, receptor antagonists
[LIST_ITEM] Skin tests: swell, wheal, flare (w/in mins) --> Type I hypersensitivity
[LIST_ITEM] RAST: bead w/ Ag + pt's serum + antihuman IgE --> if fluorescent --> allergic
[LIST_ITEM] RIST: bead + anti-human IgE + serum --> how much IgE
[LIST_ITEM] Involves binding of IgG to tgt cell and cytotoxic action/complement activation
[LIST_ITEM] Binding of antibody w/ cell membrane or tissue antigens
[LIST_ITEM] Binds to RBC of fetus --> hemolysis
[LIST_ITEM] Treat by blocking sensitization of mother anti-D Ig w/in 72 hrs of first birth
[LIST_ITEM] Platelet antigens - thrombocytopenia cell membrane - petechiae
[LIST_ITEM] Goodpasture's: antigen is basement membrane of kidney and lung
[LIST_ITEM] N'phil, frustrated phagocytosis, extracellular enzyme release
[LIST_ITEM] Hemoptysis, pulmonary infiltrates, renal failure, anemia
[LIST_ITEM] ☐ Immunofluorescence: Ig and complement deposition; linear
[LIST_ITEM] ♦ Linear antigen deposition --> Ab + complement deposition --> linear secondary anti-human Ab to IgG or complement contain fluorescent marker
[LIST_ITEM] Antibody binds to GBM --> complement --> C3b deposition + C3a/C5a --> PMN recruitment --> proteases + ROS --> tissue injury
[LIST_ITEM] Antibody binding to cell receptor (Type V rxns)
[LIST_ITEM] Grave's disease: IgG binds to TSH-R and stimulates cell to make T3/T4
[LIST_ITEM] Myasthenia Gravis: Ab to Ach-R at synapse blocks neuromuscular transmission --> muscle weakness
[LIST_ITEM] Antibody binds to antigen and deposits on tissues
[LIST_ITEM] Release of ROS and lysosomal enzymes
[LIST_ITEM] Tissue Injury (firbrinoid necrosis, hemorrhage, n'phils, Ab+complement deposition)
[LIST_ITEM] Immune response w/ Ab prod (IgM, IgG)
[LIST_ITEM] Depends on tgt organ and/or site of immune complex deposition
[LIST_ITEM] Skin tests for Type III rxns
[LIST_ITEM] Takes several hours to mainfest b/c requires complement fixation
[LIST_ITEM] Elimination of antigen - transfusion rxns, hypersensitivity lung rxns to foreign antigens, certain drug rxns
[LIST_ITEM] Corticosteroid and immunosuppressive therapy (cytoxan, cyclosporin, anti-TNFs)
[LIST_ITEM] Antigen binding to T cells causes m'phage activation and release of inflammatory mediators
[LIST_ITEM] Infiltration of lymphocytes and later macrophages, edema
[LIST_ITEM] 1st contact sensitizes --> creation of T memory cells
[LIST_ITEM] 2nd contact --> T memory cells --> Th cells --> mphage activation --> dermatitis
[LIST_ITEM] Infiltration of lymphocytes, monocytes and mphages
[LIST_ITEM] Intradermal injection used diagnostically, tuberculin, mycobacterial and leishmanial antigens
[LIST_ITEM] Granuloma containing epithelioid cells, giant cells, mphages; fibrosis +/- necrosis
[LIST_ITEM] Persistent Ag or Ag-Ab complexes in mphages or non-immunological
[LIST_ITEM] Hapten enters and is taken up by Langerhans' cells in skin
[LIST_ITEM] Germinal center forms --> T cells proliferate
[LIST_ITEM] Hapten enters and is carried to circulation
[LIST_ITEM] APC-Th1 interaction --> IL-2 --> T cell proliferation
[LIST_ITEM] IL-3,6, IFN-γ, TNF --> mphage activation --> epithelioid cell --> TNF causes fusion to make giant cell
[LIST_ITEM] Mphages and lymphocytes surround antigen-antibody complexes to prevent spread
[LIST_ITEM] Antigen expressed w/ class I MHC
[LIST_ITEM] Cytotoxic effector cell recognizes Ag+class I MHC
[LIST_ITEM] FAS-induced apoptosis: CD8+ T cell:FAS ligand
